content.text: A box with a mass of 22.0 kg is placed on a ramp that is at an angle of 38.0 degrees above the horizontal. What is the magnitude of the component of the weight that is parallel to the surface of the ramp?
THOUGHT 0: I need to find the component of the weight that is parallel to the surface of the ramp. I'll start by drawing a free body diagram to visualize the forces.

THOUGHT 1: When an object is on an inclined plane, its weight ($F_g$) can be broken down into two components: one perpendicular to the ramp ($F_{gy}$) and one parallel to the ramp ($F_{gx}$). I need to find the magnitude of $F_{gx}$.

THOUGHT 2: First, I'll calculate the weight of the box:
$F_g = mg = (22.0 \text{ kg})(9.8 \text{ m/s}^2) = 215.6 \text{ N}$

THOUGHT 3: To find the component of the weight parallel to the ramp, I need to multiply the weight by the sine of the angle:
$F_{gx} = F_g \sin(\theta) = (215.6 \text{ N})(\sin(38.0^{\circ}))$

THOUGHT 4: Calculating this value:
$F_{gx} = (215.6 \text{ N})(\sin(38.0^{\circ})) = (215.6 \text{ N})(0.6157) = 133 \text{ N}$
ANSWER: The magnitude of the component of the weight that is parallel to the surface of the ramp is 133 N.
